What is the role of differential diagnosis in the medical encounter?

Differential diagnosis is a method that helps to rule out conditions based on the information provided during the encounter, which is an important part of the process of diagnosing and treating a patient.

After examining for [signs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medical_sign "Medical sign") and interviewing for [symptoms](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Symptoms "Symptoms"), the doctor may order [medical tests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medical_test "Medical test") (e.g., [blood tests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blood_test "Blood test")), take a [biopsy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biopsy "Biopsy"), or prescribe [pharmaceutical drugs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pharmaceutical_drug "Pharmaceutical drug") or other therapies. [Differential diagnosis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Differential_diagnosis "Differential diagnosis") methods help to rule out conditions based on the information provided. During the encounter, properly informing the patient of all relevant facts is an important part of the relationship and the development of trust. The medical encounter is then documented in the medical record, which is a legal document in many jurisdictions.[11] Follow-ups may be shorter but follow the same general procedure, and specialists follow a similar process. The diagnosis and treatment may take only a few minutes or a few weeks, depending on the complexity of the issue.

What does the past medical history (PMH/PMHxinclude?
The past medical history includes concurrent medical problems, past hospitalizations and operations, injuries, past infectious diseases or vaccinations, and history of known allergies.

- [Medications](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medication "Medication") (Rx): what drugs the patient takes including [prescribed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medical_prescription "Medical prescription"), [over-the-counter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Over-the-counter_drug "Over-the-counter drug"), and [home remedies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Home_remedy "Home remedy"), as well as alternative and [herbal medicines or remedies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Herbalism "Herbalism"). [Allergies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allergy "Allergy") are also recorded. - Past medical history (PMH/PMHx): concurrent medical problems, past hospitalizations and operations, injuries, past [infectious diseases](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Infectious_disease "Infectious disease") or [vaccinations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vaccination "Vaccination"), history of known allergies. - Review of systems (ROS) or _systems inquiry_: a set of additional questions to ask, which may be missed on HPI: a general enquiry (have you noticed any [weight loss](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weight_loss "Weight loss"), change in sleep quality, fevers, lumps and bumps? etc.

What is the purpose of a Review of Systems (ROS)?

The Review of Systems, also known as a systems inquiry, is a set of additional questions to ask, which may be missed on HPI (history of present illness), to gain a more complete understanding of a patient's overall health.

- [Medications](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medication "Medication") (Rx): what drugs the patient takes including [prescribed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medical_prescription "Medical prescription"), [over-the-counter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Over-the-counter_drug "Over-the-counter drug"), and [home remedies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Home_remedy "Home remedy"), as well as alternative and [herbal medicines or remedies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Herbalism "Herbalism"). [Allergies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allergy "Allergy") are also recorded. - Past medical history (PMH/PMHx): concurrent medical problems, past hospitalizations and operations, injuries, past [infectious diseases](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Infectious_disease "Infectious disease") or [vaccinations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vaccination "Vaccination"), history of known allergies. - Review of systems (ROS) or _systems inquiry_: a set of additional questions to ask, which may be missed on HPI: a general enquiry (have you noticed any [weight loss](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weight_loss "Weight loss"), change in sleep quality, fevers, lumps and bumps? etc.
